data.statement: Framing a broadly relatable, realâ€‘world topic as a mythâ€‘busting question ("Do X actually work?")â€”especially when itâ€™s an outlier for the channelâ€™s usual physics nicheâ€”significantly boosts CTR and reach, leading to 3x+ TPS.
data.reasoning: This video pairs a practical, mass-interest object (tires) with a skeptical question format ("actually work?") that triggers curiosity and search intent beyond the channelâ€™s core audience. The novelty/outlier nature for Steve Mould likely increases recommendation diversity and click-through, while promising a definitive, testable outcome (works vs doesnâ€™t) that converts interest into watch time. Similar titles across science/DIY channels ("Do/Does X actually work?") tend to overperform due to clear payoff and myth-busting framing, making this pattern replicable and testable.
